title: Question about Legacy Chests

embed.description: Snowdown is on its way, and it's bringing a mountain of sweets, treats, and cheer! With new seasonal deals every day from December 14, 2016 through January 9, 2017 you won't want to miss it.

body:
Looking at the snowdown crafting website it says this: 
"LEGACY CHEST
295 RP (NO HEXTECH KEY REQUIRED)

A special Retired Legacy skin only chest available on weekends and containing one bonus Snowdown Sweet
**If you’re only interested in a specific Retired Legacy skin, they’ll all be available for purchase in the store during the duration of Snowdown!"**

I'm only interested in Traditional Trundle, but the only traditional skin I see in the store is Lee Sin (Yes I own Trundle) and according to https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752944-Guide-to-Legacy-and-Limited-Skins the Traditional skins are Legacy so my question is why isn't Traditional Trundle on sale in the store if other Legacy skins are? Is he only available through Legacy chests? I would like to know this before purchasing them.

EDIT: I just realized it said Retired Legacy Skins but still on the support site it says the Traditional Skins are Legacy so if they're not available in store could I have a chance through boxes?

replies.body:
Traditional Trundle isn't a legacy skin, it's technically a rare skin that is given to players who owned that specific champion prior to its rework. Technically Lee Sin's traditional skin is only a name and is **not** part of the *Traditional Skins* that are specifically part of the pre-rework set. This is why you don't see Trundle's traditional skin for sale on the store. You **can** potentially get a skin shard for any of the oldschool pre-rework *Traditional Skins* through any hextech crafting box, but as with all hextech crafting, it's all based on luck & RNG.

Let me know if you have any questions.

First off thanks for the timely and accurate reply. I actually do have a couple more questions.

Basically what you're telling me is that the skin shard has a chance to drop with any hextech box and that the Legacy box is just for retired legacy skins which would not be Traditional Trundle so basically I'd have to get lucky with regular hextech crafting kind of like with Gemstones only with a lower drop rate. That kinda sucks because I was hoping that the Legacy chests would not just be for retired Legacy skins but for all legacy skins.
Yes, you'd need to be incredibly lucky to specifically pull *Traditional Trundle* from a Hextech Crafting box.
It's based on a bit more than luck. Only Riot knows the official odds though.
